Hydrated CMC (CMC·nH 2O) and anhydrous CMC were synthesised via ionic exchange and heat treatment
30, 31 . First, Cs[CB 11H 12] (2.759 g, 10 mmol, Katchem Ltd.) was converted into the corresponding acid [H 3O][CB 11H 12] through ion exchange(acidic form of Ambarlite IR120B, 20 mL). Aqueous Ca[CB 11H 12] 2 was prepared by neutralising [H 3O][CB 11H 12] with excess CaCO 3(1.501 g, 1.5 eq, FUJIFILM Wako Pure Chemical Co.). Solvent removal yielded hydrated CMC, which was further dried under vacuum (< 8 × 10 −4 Pa) at 433 K for 10 h to obtain CMC
32 . DME (Sigma-Aldrich), THF (Sigma-Aldrich), DME/THF mixed solvent, diglyme, and triglyme were stored over 3-A molecular sieves prior to use, yielding measured water levels of < 10 ppm. To prepare Ca electrolytes, CMC was dissolved in a volumetric flask with appropriate amounts of each solvent to achieve the desired or saturated concentration. The molar concentration of the electrolyte is based on the molar mass of CMC.
